dublin_core.dcvalue: Preoperative communication between the prosthodontist and surgeon is required for properly planning the surgical prostheses that are often indicated for maxillectomy patients When geography or long distances preclude face to face consultation electronic means of correspondence are necessary to minimize delays in the fabrication of surgical prostheses This article presents a time efficient procedure for facilitation of the necessary communication between the prosthodontist and surgeon before maxillectomy surgical procedures
Journal of prosthodontics : official journal of the American College of Prosthodontists
Using a facsimile (fax) as an aid for communication in maxillectomy planning between the prosthodontist and surgeon.
